title: The Week in Ransomware - June 23rd 2023 - The Reddit Files
description: It was a relatively quiet week regarding ransomware news, with the BlackCat ransomware gang extorting Reddit and the ongoing MOVEit Transfer data breaches being the main focus. [...]

title: University of Manchester confirms data theft in recent cyberattack
description: The University of Manchester finally confirmed that attackers behind a cyberattack disclosed in early June had stolen data belonging to alumni and current students. [...]

title: CISA orders agencies to patch iPhone bugs abused in spyware attacks
description: Today, CISA ordered federal agencies to patch recently patched security vulnerabilities exploited as zero-days to deploy Triangulation spyware on iPhones via iMessage zero-click exploits. [...]

title: FBI seizes BreachForums after arresting its owner Pompompurin in March
description: U.S. law enforcement today seized the clear web domain of the notorious BreachForums (aka Breached) hacking forum three months after apprehending its owner Conor Fitzpatrick (aka Pompompurin), under cybercrime charges. [...]

title: MOVEIt breach impacts GenWorth, CalPERS as data for 3.2 million exposed
description: PBI Research Services (PBI) has suffered a data breach with three clients disclosing that the data for 4.75 million people was stolen in the recent MOVEit Transfer data-theft attacks. [...]

title: Fortinet fixes critical FortiNAC remote command execution flaw
description: Cybersecurity solutions company Fortinet has updated its zero-trust access solution FortiNAC to address a critical-severity vulnerability that attackers could leverage to execute code and commands. [...]
